src:
Padres de la bebé fallecida en Cuba desde México: "Queremos que haya justicia"
07 Nov 2019, 12:57 by Jose Nacher
Los padres de Paloma Domínguez Caballero, la niña que falleció en Cuba tras recibir una vacuna, exigieron desde México justicia y una explicación del gobierno de la Isla un mes después del trágico suceso.
Estamos tratando de asimilar todo y sobre todo seguir en esta lucha de exigir justicia", aseguró Yaima Caballero a América Tevé.
Ella y su esposo Osmany Dominguez se han tenido que marchar al país azteca ante las amenazas que han sufrido por parte de agentes de la Seguridad del Estado.
Las amenazas de la Seguridad del Estado
"Contactaron con nosotros para hacernos saber que estaban pendientes de las denuncias que hacíamos en las redes sociales. Los compañeros que nos citan pensábamos que eran del Ministerio de Salud", explicó. Lejos de recibir apoyo, lo que se encontraron fueron mensajes intimidatorios.
"Nos hicieron saber que ellos conocían de las denuncias que estábamos haciendo. Que era un crimen estar haciendo falsas acusaciones y que los crímenes se pagan con la cárcel", dijo al citado medio.
"Se dieron cuenta de que con todo lo que me habían dicho, no habían calmado mis ganas de exigir justicia. Pero yo me iba a tomar mi tiempo para salir hacia México porque tenía que tramitar algunos papeles", reveló Caballero.
A partir de ese momento, esta mujer vio cómo la farragosa burocracia se agilizó de forma inesperada. "Cuando fui a viajar mi pasaporte estaba vencido. En Cuba se demora 20 día hacerlo nuevo, hice las gestiones el lunes y el jueves me llamaron para decirme que ya estaba el pasaporte. Es la primera vez en 35 años que veo que un trámite que se demora 20 días, esté en tres días. Entendimos el mensaje", aseguró.
Desde México ella y Osmany viven con dolor cómo el gobierno cubano insiste en no dar ninguna explicación sobre la muerte de Paloma.
"Nosotros confiamos en la salud cubana y llevamos a vacunar a nuestra hija"
"Nosotros confiamos en la salud cubana y llevamos a vacunar a nuestra hija simplemente para que se mantuviera sana. En el momento que sucede algo así los primeros que tienen que dar la cara son los que implantan el tema de las vacunas y dar apoyo a la familia que pierde un hijo. Pero eso no sucedió nunca", lamentó Domínguez.
"Estamos exigiendo a nuestro gobierno que nos de una respuesta sobre lo que sucedió, algo que hasta ahora no ha sucedido", añadió.
"La asesinaron y es algo que voy a seguir diciendo cada día"
Yaima dijo que al no recibir explicaciones de las autoridades cubanas está en su derecho a pensar "que pudo suceder cualquier cosa". "No sé ya ni qué pensar, que quizás no le dieron la atención necesaria o que le dieron demasiada. Ella estuvo dos días luchando por su vida, cada vez iba empeorando y supuestamente le iban dando antibióticos de última generación", recordó.
"El hecho de que Paloma haya sido la única fallecida me da mucho que pensar y siguen habiendo dudas en mi cabeza, independientemente de quién tuvo que ver con su muerte. Puedo pensar que todos tuvieron algo de culpa, pero a día de hoy seguimos sin saber lo que pasó", reiteró.
La madre de la bebé sostiene que "asesinaron" a su hija. "La mataron, la asesinaron y es algo que voy a seguir diciendo cada día que me levante", afirmó.
text:
Parents of the deceased baby in Cuba from Mexico: "We want there to be justice"
07 Nov 2019, 12:57 by Jose Nacher
Paloma Domínguez Caballero's parents, the girl who died in Cuba after receiving a vaccine, demanded justice and an explanation from the Island government from Mexico a month after the tragic event.
We are trying to assimilate everything and above all continue in this fight to demand justice, "Yaima Caballero assured America Tevé.
She and her husband Osmany Dominguez have had to leave the Aztec country because of the threats they have suffered from State Security agents.
The threats of State Security
"They contacted us to let us know that they were pending the complaints we made on social networks. The colleagues who cited us thought they were from the Ministry of Health," he explained. Far from receiving support, what they found were intimidating messages.
"They let us know that they knew about the allegations we were making. That it was a crime to be making false accusations and that the crimes are paid with jail," he told the media outlet.
"They realized that with everything they had told me, they had not calmed my desire to demand justice. But I was going to take my time to go to Mexico because I had to process some papers," Caballero revealed.
From that moment, this woman saw how the bureaucratic bureaucracy was sped up unexpectedly. "When I went to travel my passport was expired. In Cuba it takes 20 days to make it new, I made the arrangements on Monday and Thursday they called me to tell me that the passport was already there. It is the first time in 35 years that I see a procedure that it takes 20 days, be in three days. We got the message, "he said.
From Mexico she and Osmany live in pain as the Cuban government insists on not giving any explanation about Paloma's death.
"We trust Cuban health and take our daughter to vaccinate"
"We are confident in Cuban health and have our daughter vaccinated simply so she could stay healthy. At the time something like this happens, the first ones who have to show their faces are the ones who implant the issue of vaccines and support the family that loses a child. But that never happened, "Dominguez said.
"We are demanding from our government to give us an answer about what happened, something that has not happened so far," he added.
"She was murdered and it is something that I will continue to say every day"
Yaima said that by not receiving explanations from the Cuban authorities, he has the right to think "anything could happen." "I don't know what to think anymore, that maybe they didn't give him the necessary attention or that they gave him too much. She spent two days fighting for her life, every time she was getting worse and supposedly they were giving her last generation antibiotics," he recalled.
"The fact that Paloma was the only deceased gives me a lot to think about and there are still doubts in my head, regardless of who had to do with his death. I can think that everyone had some guilt, but today we still have no know what happened, "he reiterated.
The baby's mother says they "murdered" her daughter. "They killed her, they killed her and it is something that I will continue to say every day that I get up," he said.
